properties.areaDesc: Waters from Jupiter Inlet to Deerfield Beach FL from 20 to 60 NM; Biscayne Bay; Coastal waters from Deerfield Beach to Ocean Reef FL out 20 NM; Waters from Deerfield Beach to Ocean Reef FL from 20 to 60 NM excluding the territorial waters of Bahamas
properties.headline: Special Marine Warning issued February 1 at 12:25AM EST until February 1 at 2:30AM EST by NWS Miami FL
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Miami has issued a

* Special Marine Warning for...
Biscayne Bay...
Coastal waters from Deerfield Beach to Ocean Reef FL out 20 NM...
Waters from Deerfield Beach to Ocean Reef FL from 20 to 60 NM
excluding the territorial waters of Bahamas...
Waters from Jupiter Inlet to Deerfield Beach FL from 20 to 60 NM...

* Until 230 AM EST.

* At 1224 AM EST, severe thunderstorms capable of producing
waterspouts were located along a line extending from near Sunny
Isles to 15 nm east of Miami Beach to 22 nm east of Carysfort Reef
Light to 18 nm northeast of Floyd's Wall Northeast, moving east at
35 knots.

HAZARD...Probable waterspouts, wind gusts in excess of 50 knots,
and small hail.

SOURCE...Radar.

IMPACT...Waterspouts can easily overturn boats and create locally
hazardous seas. Boats could suffer significant structural
damage in high winds. Small craft could capsize in
suddenly higher waves.

* Locations impacted include...
Sunny Isles.
properties.instruction:
Move to safe harbor immediately as gusty winds and high waves are
expected.

Report severe weather to the Coast Guard or the National Weather
Service. You can also share your report with NWS Miami on Facebook
and Twitter.
